Word.word: The word in the dictionary (any word that would be defined).
Word.aspirate: Whether or not the word starts with an aspirate h. Some adjectives that come before words that start with a non-aspirate h have an extra form (AdjectiveForms -> na [non-aspirate]).

GrammaticalForm.form: The grammatical form of the word is the grammatical context in which it is used. Forms may consist of a word in noun, adjective, adverb, exclamatory or other form.
GrammaticalForm.definition: The definition of the word in a certain grammatical form.

Context.context: The context is a specific context in which the word is used. Examples would include the word "bien" in context of morality, quantity, beauty, intensity, and others. Context helps to describe different usages of the word.
Context.description: The description of the context is the meaning of the word in that particular context. Some contexts may be defined solely by examples, some may have a more general meaning with specific examples to help clarify usages.

Example.usage: A usage is a particular phrase or example of the word in context of colloquial language the explains the word by example.
Example.explanation: An explanation is the explanation of a usage in a context. This is essentially a sub-definition of the word, as meaning changes within context and within usages.

NounTable.ms: The masculin singular form of the noun.
NounTable.fs: The feminin singular form of the noun.
NounTable.mpl: The masculin plural form of the noun.
NounTable.fpl: The feminin plural form of the noun.
NounTable.gender: The gender of the noun. Determines

AdjectiveTable.ms: The masculin singular form of the adjective.
AdjectiveTable.fs: The feminin singular form of the adjective.
AdjectiveTable.mpl: The masculin plural form of the adjective.
AdjectiveTable.fpl: The feminin plural form of the adjective.
AdjectiveTable.na: The non-aspirate form of the adjective, in the case where the adjective is followed by a non-aspirate word.
AdjectiveTable.location: Where the adjective is placed around the noun (before, after, or both).

VerbTable.group: What group the verb belongs to (1st, 2nd, 3rd or exception).
VerbTable.auxillary: The auxillary verb taken by the verb.
VerbTable.prepositions: A CSV list of valid prepositions this verb uses; for grammatical analysis.
VerbTable.transitive: Whether or not the verb is transitive.
VerbTable.pronominal: The pronominal infinitive form of the verb, if the verb allows pronominal construction.

Infinitive.present: The present infinitive form of the verb.
Infinitive.past: The past infinitive form of the verb.

Participle.present: The present participle of the verb.
Participle.past: The past partciple of the verb.

AdjectiveTable.ms: The masculin singular form of the adjective.
AdjectiveTable.fs: The feminin singular form of the adjective.
AdjectiveTable.mpl: The masculin plural form of the adjective.
AdjectiveTable.fpl: The feminin plural form of the adjective.
AdjectiveTable.na: The non-aspirate form of the adjective, in the case where the adjective is followed by a non-aspirate word.
AdjectiveTable.location: Where the adjective is placed around the noun (before, after, or both).
